title: May welcomes U.S. expulsions over spy attack in call with Trump
text:
March 28, 2018 / 3:21 PM / Updated 3 hours ago May welcomes U.S. expulsions over spy attack in call with Trump Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
LONDON (Reuters) - British Prime Minister Theresa May welcomed a U.S. move to expel 60 Russian diplomats over a chemical attack on a former Russian spy in the English city of Salisbury in a phone call with President Donald Trump, her spokesman said on Wednesday. Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May leaves 10 Downing Street in Westminster, London, Britain, March 26, 2018. REUTERS/Hannah McKay 
“The prime minister today spoke with President Trump to welcome the U.S. decision to expel 60 Russian diplomats in response to the use of a nerve agent in Salisbury,” the spokesman told reporters. 
“The PM said the U.S. had delivered a very strong response and welcomed the breadth of international action in response to Russia’s reckless and brazen behaviour, with 26 countries now putting expulsions in place.” Reporting by Elizabeth Piper; editing by Stephen Addison
